benchmark_details.name: RAG-Check: Evaluating Multimodal Retrieval Augmented Generation Performance
benchmark_details.overview: RAG-Check is a novel framework designed to evaluate the reliability of multi-modal retrieval-augmented generation systems. It includes two performance measures: the relevancy score (RS) for assessing the relevance of retrieved entries to the query and the correctness score (CS) for evaluating the accuracy of the generated response.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of multi-modal RAG systems by quantifying the relevance and correctness of their generated outputs.

data.source: 5000-sample human-annotated database evaluating the relevancy of retrieved pieces and the correctness of response statements.
data.annotation: Human annotation for evaluating the relevancy and correctness.

methods: Neural network structure for RS and CS
methodology.calculation: RS is calculated based on the relevance of retrieved entries and CS is determined by the correctness of generated spans based on raw context.
methodology.interpretation: A higher RS indicates better relevance of retrieved pieces to the query, while a higher CS signifies that the generated responses are accurate relative to the retrieved raw context.
methodology.validation: Trained on a dataset comprising human evaluator samples and a ChatGPT-derived database.
